html:
2025-0637
2025-08-29FIN, MSUSTCustoms TariffOrder Amending and Repealing Certain Orders Made Under the Customs Tariff (United States Surtax)Order Amending and Repealing Certain Orders Made Under the Customs Tariff (United States Surtax) in order to (1) remove tariffs on the full set of goods ($30.3 billion in annual imports from the U.S.) listed under the United States Surtax Order (2025-1), as well as all of the non-steel and non-aluminum goods ($14.4 billion in annual imports) listed under the United States Surtax Order (Steel and Aluminum 2025), from September 1, 2025 onwards; (2) amend the United States Surtax Order (Motor Vehicles 2025) to exclude heavy electric trucks (i.e., those with a gross vehicle weight over five tonnes) and vintage vehicles so that surtaxes will not apply to those goods; and (3) amend retroactively the United States Surtax Order (Steel and Aluminum 2025) to ensure that reusable steel containers, such as canisters and racks for automotive parts, are not subject to the surtax when imported temporarily into Canada.Registration: SOR/2025-0181 Publication Date: 2025-09-10
subject: Order Amending and Repealing Certain Orders Made Under the Customs Tariff (United States Surtax)
precis: Order Amending and Repealing Certain Orders Made Under the Customs Tariff (United States Surtax) in order to (1) remove tariffs on the full set of goods ($30.3 billion in annual imports from the U.S.) listed under the United States Surtax Order (2025-1), as well as all of the non-steel and non-aluminum goods ($14.4 billion in annual imports) listed under the United States Surtax Order (Steel and Aluminum 2025), from September 1, 2025 onwards; (2) amend the United States Surtax Order (Motor Vehicles 2025) to exclude heavy electric trucks (i.e., those with a gross vehicle weight over five tonnes) and vintage vehicles so that surtaxes will not apply to those goods; and (3) amend retroactively the United States Surtax Order (Steel and Aluminum 2025) to ensure that reusable steel containers, such as canisters and racks for automotive parts, are not subject to the surtax when imported temporarily into Canada.
